title.narrative: SOCIAL CHANGE TO END VAC

description.narrative: The Filipino public are more informed and equipped to engage Government to call for its commitment and action to eliminate all forms of violence against children, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, moreÂ children and adolescents, particularly the most vulnerable, benefitÂ from more effective, quality, gender-sensitive, preventive, and responsive child protection system, and live in communities that better protect children from violence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Filipino public are more informed and equipped to engage Government to call for its commitment and action to eliminate allforms of violence against children

description.narrative: UNICEF continues supporting the government in ensuring;social;and behaviour change (SBC) for child protection through the localization of the Philippine Plan of Action to End Violence Against Children (PPAEVAC) and finalization;of the PPAEVAC Advocacy and Communication Plan. Increased investments were also mobilised towards supporting the SBC plan of the SaferKidsPH focused on addressing online violence and;contributing;to more protective online behaviour of children. Such programmes;ensure that parents, caregiver, children and youth members are empowered to call for;government to end VAC in their respective localities, through creation of local manifestos, plans, and ordinances as well as youth mobilization activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/12/2021
